name: uncertified
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not having an official document to show that something or someone has reached a particular standard, or that information is true: Although the system has tried to attract qualified new teachers, the number of uncertified teachers has risen. The report cited the use of untrained, unqualified and uncertified contractors.
More examplesFewer examplesOfficials have known for years that uncertified chemical companies are producing pharmaceutical ingredients. Many migrant camps are uncertified, and therefore they escape inspections. If you just want an uncertified copy of the marriage records, then you can easily get them by searching online.
